_desc.NAICS_DESCRIPTION: Petroleum and Petroleum Products Merchant Wholesalers (except Bulk Stations and Terminals)

_exec_summary.SummaryText:
Zippo Manufacturing Company operates a facility in Custer City, Pennsylvania that is a butane filling operation where consumer cans of butane are filled and sold to the marketplace. 



Accidental Release Prevention and Emergency Response Policies:

The facility was built following all applicable codes including, but not limited to: NFPA 54, NFPA 58, NFPA 70 & 70E, along with any and all building construction codes.  The facility is also equipped with state-of-the-art fire suppression systems, gas detectors, surveillance and security systems.  Zippo Manufacturing Company prides itself on our commitment to safety and has put in place rules, guidelines and procedures to adhere to any and all federal, state and local regulations.   All employees have completed training in Liquefied Petroleum Gas Safety, Hazardous Materials, Process Safety Management and Emergency Action Procedures.  Zippo Manufacturing Company also has an exceptional working relationship with local and county emergency agencies.  Zippo Manufacturing Company has also completed tours of the facility with the local emergency agencies to familiarize them with our facility, the hazards associated with our processes, and the extensive safety devices and procedures already in place, should an emergency arise.   



Facility Description and Regulated Substances:

This facility maintains a butane can filling operation that consists of respective process equipment along with an 18,000 gallon and a 1,850 gallon butane storage tanks.  The butane storage tanks are filled to 80% capacity to allow for natural expansion.  The tank farm is in a fenced-in area with locked gates deterring anyone from entering. Within the tank farm there is also an outbuilding that houses ethyl mercaptan, an odorant for butane.  Currently there are 2-five gallon cylinders of ethyl mercaptan in containments in the outbuilding.  The facility is secure, locked and under surveillance twenty-four hours per day, 7 days per week.  In addition, S

ecurity officers continually monitor this facility via foot and vehicle patrols.



General Accidental Release Prevention Programs and Chemical Specific Prevention Steps:

This facility was designed, installed and maintained in accordance with NFPA-58 regulations.  A preventive maintenance program has been established for all components of the operation to maintain integrity.   This facility also complies with the OSHA PSM standard, as well as all applicable federal, state and local laws and regulations.  A multitude of safety devices are installed on all affected equipment including, but not limited to: pressure relief devices, automatic shutting valves, emergency shut off devices, breakaway bulkhead piping, dual (redundant) fire suppression systems, gas detection systems and emergency HVAC evacuation systems.  Training is provided to all employees who may play a role in this facility.  Along with training, precise programs and procedures have been put in place to avoid any accidents or releases.  



Five-Year Accident History:

We have never had an accident involving butane that caused deaths, injuries, property or environmental damage, evacuations, or shelterings in place.



Emergency Response Program:

An Emergency Action Plan has been implemented at this facility.  As part of this plan, all employees have been trained in specific procedures to allow them to react safely to an emergency situation.  Employees have been trained on how to operate all emergency devices within the facility (i.e., emergency shut off devices, fire extinguishers, first aid/AED equipment, fire alarm systems, electrical emergencies, etc.).  Also, as part of the Emergency Action Plan, coordination is made with local and county emergency agencies.  These agencies have toured the facility and have conducted pre-plans for training purposes.  This will allow them to be prepared ahead of time, should an actual emergency arise.  During an actual emergency, procedures are in place to allow comm

unication with local television, radio and newspaper companies to better educate the public.



Planned Changes to Improve Safety:

Zippo Manufacturing Company continues to monitor for improvements.
